Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.session

Class SessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.session.SessionManager
  • public class SessionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages HTTP sessions for a servlet context.

    Each servlet context creates one SessionManager instance to handle session lifecycle, including creation, retrieval, invalidation, and optional cluster replication.

    The SessionManager has a unique context UUID that identifies this context instance within the cluster. This UUID is regenerated on hot deployment to trigger session repopulation from other nodes.

    Usage: 

     // Create manager for a context
 SessionManager manager = new SessionManager(context);

 // Register with cluster (done by Container)
 cluster.registerContext(manager.getContextUuid(), manager);

 // Create or get sessions
 HttpSession session = manager.getSession(requestedId, true);

 // Replicate after request processing
 manager.replicateSession(session);
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      SessionManager​(SessionContext context)
      Creates a new session manager for the given context.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionManager

        public SessionManager​(SessionContext context)
        Creates a new session manager for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - the session context

    • Method Detail

      • getContextUuid

        public java.util.UUID getContextUuid()
        Returns the context UUID for this session manager. This UUID uniquely identifies this context instance within the cluster and is regenerated on hot deployment.
        Returns:
        the context UUID

      • regenerateContextUuid

        public java.util.UUID regenerateContextUuid()
        Regenerates the context UUID. This should be called when the context is reloaded (hot deployment) to signal to other cluster nodes that this context needs session repopulation.
        Returns:
        the new context UUID

      • setCluster

        public void setCluster​(Cluster cluster)
        Sets the cluster reference for this session manager. Called by the Container when clustering is enabled.
        Parameters:
        cluster - the cluster, or null to disable clustering

      • isClusteringEnabled

        public boolean isClusteringEnabled()
        Returns whether clustering is enabled for this manager.
        Returns:
        true if clustering is enabled

      • getContext

        public SessionContext getContext()
        Returns the session context.
        Returns:
        the session context

      • createSession

        public javax.servlet.http.HttpSession createSession()
        Creates a new session with a randomly generated ID.
        Returns:
        the new session

      • getSession

        public javax.servlet.http.HttpSession getSession​(java.lang.String id,
                                                 boolean create)
        Gets or creates a session.
        Parameters:
        id - the session ID to look up, or null to create a new session
        create - true to create a new session if not found
        Returns:
        the session, or null if not found and create is false

      • getSession

        public javax.servlet.http.HttpSession getSession​(java.lang.String id)
        Gets a session by ID without creating.
        Parameters:
        id - the session ID
        Returns:
        the session, or null if not found

      • removeSession

        public void removeSession​(java.lang.String id)
        Removes a session.
        Parameters:
        id - the session ID

      • removeSession

        public void removeSession​(java.lang.String id,
                          boolean notifyCluster)
        Removes a session with optional cluster notification.
        Parameters:
        id - the session ID
        notifyCluster - true to notify the cluster of removal

      • replicateSession

        public void replicateSession​(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Replicates a session to the cluster if clustering is enabled and the session is dirty.
        Parameters:
        session - the session to replicate

      • getAllSessions

        public java.util.Collection<org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.session.Session> getAllSessions()
        Returns all sessions. Used for cluster replication when a new node joins.
        Returns:
        collection of all sessions

      • invalidateExpiredSessions

        public void invalidateExpiredSessions()
        Invalidates expired sessions. Called periodically by the container.
